name: Phantom
description: This App exposes various Phantom APIs as actions

phantom_server.description: Phantom IP or Hostname (e.g. 10.1.1.10 or valid_phantom_hostname)

deflate_item_extensions.description: Only files with the specified extensions (comma-separated) will be deflated. If blank, file extension will not be checked

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
Update or overwrite Phantom artifact with the provided input
actions.verbose:
Overwrite

By default, this action will append or update these fields: "cef_json", "cef_types_json", and "tags", unless "overwrite" is enabled. In which case, those parameters will replace the entirety of current versions of what that artifact contains.

Optional Fields

While all are not required, for the action to run, at least one of the following optional parameters need to be provided:
PARAMETEREXAMPLE
nameArtifact Name
labelartifact_label
severityhigh
cef_json{"key1": "value1", "goodDomain": "www.splunk.com", "remove_me": ""}
cef_types_json{"goodDomain": ["domain"]}
tagstag1, tag3 or ["tag2", "tag4"]
artifact_json{"source_data_identifier": "myTicket1234", "label": "new_label"}

Artifact JSON

Artifact JSON should be used for more advanced aspects of Phantom artifacts. See Phantom REST API docs, specifically regarding artifacts.

cef_json.description: JSON format of the CEF fields you want in the artifact

cef_types_json.description: JSON format of the CEF types (e.g., {'myIP': ['ip', 'ipv6']})

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to add or replace in the artifact

overwrite.description: Overwrite artifacts with provided input (applies to: cef_json, contains_json, tags)

artifact_json.description: JSON format of entire artifact (Always overwrites provided keys)

actions.description: Add a note to a container
actions.verbose: If the container_id parameter is left empty, then it will be initialized to the current container's id (from where the action is being run) and the status will be reflected accordingly. If the container is a case, a phase_id parameter can be provided to associate the note to a particular phase.

container_id.description: The container id (defaults to current container)

phase_id.description: Phase the note will be associated with

example_values: Adding a note via app action

add_tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to add to the artifact

remove_tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags to remove from the artifact

example_values: Tags added: tag1, Tags removed: tag2, Tags already present: tag3, Tags already absent: tag4

actions.description: Find artifacts containing a CEF value
actions.verbose:
If the limit_search parameter is set to true, then the action will search the required artifact in the provided container_ids only. Otherwise, the container_ids parameter will be ignored.

If any non-integer value is provided in the container_ids parameter, then all the non-integer values will be removed and the parameter will be updated accordingly. If the value of the container_ids parameter is current, then it will be replaced by the current container's id(from which the action is being run) and the status will be reflected accordingly.

If the exact_match parameter is set to false, then the action will return all those artifacts for which the values parameter is a substring of any one of its cef values. Otherwise it will return those artifacts for which any one of its cef value matches exactly with the values parameter.

For the values of type integer, float or string, it is suggested to set the exact_match parameter to false.

By default, 10 artifacts are returned. If you would like to return more or less than 10 artifacts, update the max_results parameter.

cef_key.description: Key of the cef dict you are querying: act, app, applicationProtocol, baseEventCount, bytesIn, etc. It will search the entire cef dictionary if blank

limit_search.description: Limit search to specified containers (default: false)

container_ids.description: List of space or comma separated container ids. the word "current" will be replaced by the current container id

max_results.description: Maximum number of artifacts to return

actions.description: Add value to a custom list
actions.verbose:
To add a row containing a single value to a list simply pass the value. However, to pass multiple values in a row, format it like a JSON array (e.g. ["item1", "item2", "item3"]).

The action will update the list, if the list already exists (even if the create parameter is set to true).

After creating or updating a list through this action, if the same list is updated from the UI, then the user needs to save those changes before updating the list through this action again, otherwise, the changes made from the UI will be overridden.

list.description: Name or ID of a custom list

create.description: Create list if it does not exist (default: false)

actions.description: Find value in a custom list
actions.verbose:
Row and column coordinates for each matching value can be found in the result summary under "locations". The match is case sensitive.

If the exact_match parameter is set to false, then the action will return all those strings for which the values parameter is its substring. Otherwise it will return those strings which match exactly with the values parameter.

list.description: Name or ID of a custom list

example_values: Server: https://10.1.1.10, Found matches: 1, Locations: [(1, 0)], List id: 18

actions.description: Add a new artifact to a container
actions.verbose:
If the container_id parameter is left empty, then it will be initialized to the current container's id (from which the action is being run) and the status will be reflected accordingly.

CEF fields can be added to the artifact in two ways, either by using the cef_name and cef_value parameter or by using the cef_dictionary parameter. If the cef_name, cef_value, and cef_dictionary parameters are all included, the action will add the cef_name field to the cef_dictionary.

Using only the cef_name and cef_value parameter will result in the artifact having one CEF field.

The cef_dictionary parameter takes a JSON dictionary with key-value pairs representing CEF key-value pairs. To provide values containing double-quotes("), add a backslash(\) before the double-quotes.
For e.g., {"X-Universally-Unique-Identifier":"test","Content-Type":"multipart/alternative; boundary=\"Apple-Mail=_0DA95D7E-B791-4751-8043-175949088A2C\">","Message-Id":""}

The contains parameter can take a JSON dictionary, with the keys matching the keys of the cef_dictionary and the values being lists of possible contains for the CEF field. If a given value in the cef_dictionary is not present in the contains dictionary, the action will first check the list of default CEF fields. If not a default CEF field, then the action will attempt to identify the appropriate value for contains.
The contains parameter can also take a string(or a comma-separated list of strings) representing the contains for the cef_value parameter. This method should be used only if the cef_name and cef_value parameters are used.

If the run_automation parameter is set to true then the active playbooks will run automatically after the artifact is added. The active playbooks will run on the same container in which the artifact is added.

See the REST API Documentation for more information on artifacts, CEF fields, and contains.

container_id.description: Numeric container ID for the new artifact

contains.description: Data type for each CEF field

run_automation.description: Run automation on newly created artifact(s) (default: false)

determine_contains.description: Determine contains for any CEF fields without a provided contains value (default: true)

example_values: Artifact id: 12345, Container id: 1234, Server: https://10.1.1.10

actions.description: Deflates an item from the vault
actions.verbose:
The action will be supported only if the phantom_server parameter (in the asset configurations) is configured to the local Phantom instance, i.e., the instance from which the action is being run.

The action detects if the input vault item is a compressed file and deflates it. Every file found after deflation is then added to the vault. If container_id is specified will add to its vault, else to the current (the container whose context the action is executed) container. The action supports zip, gzip, bz2, tar, and tgz file types. In the case where the compressed file contains another compressed file in it, set the recursive parameter to true to deflate the inner compressed file.

If recursion is enabled and a password is specified, the application will use the password for given zip file only. The inner zip file will be extracted only if the file is not password protected. Among the different compression methods, only the zip supports password protection functionality.

For certain Unicode characters, the file name is not unzipped as it is, by the zipfile module.

actions.description: Export local container to the configured Phantom asset
actions.verbose:
This action exports a container (that matches the container_id) from the local Phantom instance (the instance from where the action is being run) to the configured Phantom asset (that the action is being executed on).

The action will fail with an error message like severity instance with name u'critical' does not exist, if the container metadata on the local phantom instance and the configured Phantom asset does not match.

Set the keep_owner parameter to true if you want the owner of the container on the configured Phantom instance to match the owner on the local instance. Note that this will be based on Owner ID, not Owner Name.

label.description: Label to name the export container. If blank, the export container will have the same name as the local container

actions.description: Import a container from an external Phantom instance
actions.verbose:
This action imports a container (that matches the container_id) from the configured Phantom asset (that the action is being executed on) into the local Phantom instance (the instance from where the action is being run).

The action will fail with an error message like severity instance with name u'critical' does not exist, if the container metadata on the configured Phantom asset and the local phantom instance does not match.

Set the keep_owner parameter to true if you want the owner of the container on the local Phantom instance to match the owner on the configured instance. Note that this will be based on Owner ID, not Owner Name.

actions.description: Create a new container on a Phantom instance
actions.verbose:
This action creates a new container on the Phantom server, which is configured in the phantom_server asset parameter. The container_json parameter needs to be a JSON string. It is mandatory to provide a label key in the container_json parameter. The action will fail if the container_json has a label that does not exist on the destination Phantom asset.
E.g., {"name":"Test Container","label":"events"}

The container_artifacts is an optional parameter that needs to be a list of artifact objects as a JSON string. Each artifact JSON object should contain the following keys: cef, cef_types, data, description, end_time, ingest_app_id, kill_chain, label, name, owner_id, severity, source_data_identifier, start_time, tags, type. All other keys will be ignored.
E.g., [{"name": "artifact 1", "label":"label1", "cef": {"test": "123"}},{"name": "artifact 2", "label":"label2", "cef": {"test": "456"}}]

See Splunk Phantom Documentation for further details.

example_values: [{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (1)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 1},{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (2)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 2},{"name": "A human friendly name for artifact (3)", "label": "event", "source_data_identifier": 3}]
{"severity": "medium", "label": "events", "version": 1, "asset": 7, "status": "new", "description": "New Container from Phantom Helper", "tags": [],  "data": {}, "name": "This is a container"}

actions.description: Find the results of a previously run action
actions.verbose:
This action returns the most recent results of the given action_name launched with the given parameters within the given time_limit.

The action will limit the number of results returned to the value in max_results. By default, the limit is 10. To get all the results, set themax_results parameter to 0.

The parameters parameter takes a JSON string in the format:

{
    "parameter_name1": "parameter_value1"
    "parameter_name2": "parameter_value2"
    ...
}

The app parameter takes an app name, and if it is included, the action will only search for action results from that app. Similarly, the asset parameter takes an asset name, and if it is included, the action will only search for action results from that asset.

time_limit.description: Number of hours to search back

max_results.description: Maximum number of action results to return

actions.verbose: Either the list_name or id is required. If both, list_name and id parameters are provided and both of them point to different lists, then the list_name parameter will be preferred and the action will update the list specified in the list_name parameter.

row_number.description: Row number in list to be modified

row_values_as_list.description: JSON formatted list of new values for the row

actions.description: Wait for the specified number of seconds
